source.a1c7af67:
import scipy.stats as stats
import pylab
source.2781c39b:
#### If you want to check whether feature is guassian or normal distributed
#### Q-Q plot
def plot_data(df,feature):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
    plt.subplot(1,2,1)
    df[feature].hist()
    plt.subplot(1,2,2)
    stats.probplot(df[feature],dist='norm',plot=pylab)
    plt.show()
